title: [aerospace] High Employee Turnover Risk in Operations
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14), but the salary grades are concentrated in G06 and G07. This could indicate a lack of career progression opportunities, leading to potential turnover.
business_impact: High turnover can lead to increased recruitment costs and operational disruptions.

title: [aerospace] Maintenance Cost Variability
description: The average parts cost for aircraft maintenance is $6965, but the maximum reported is $125,000. This variability could indicate inconsistent maintenance practices or unexpected repairs.
recommendations: Conduct regular audits of maintenance costs
business_impact: High variability in maintenance costs can lead to budget overruns and operational inefficiencies.

title: [aerospace] Frequent Delays in Flight Operations
description: The average delay across recorded flights is 10.49 minutes, with a maximum of 45 minutes. This indicates potential inefficiencies in flight scheduling or operational processes.
business_impact: Frequent delays can affect customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

title: [aerospace] Concentration of Baggage Handling Issues
description: With only 2% of baggage reported as damaged and claims filed, this indicates potential issues in baggage handling processes, especially since all bags are categorized as 'CHECKED'.
recommendations: Implement additional training for ground staff
business_impact: Improving baggage handling can enhance customer trust and reduce compensation costs.

title: [aerospace] Over-reliance on Specific Airlines
description: The dataset shows a concentration of maintenance activities for specific airlines (e.g., KE and OZ). This could pose risks if these airlines face operational issues.
recommendations: Assess risk exposure for current airline dependencies
business_impact: Over-reliance on few airlines can lead to operational disruptions if those airlines face challenges.

title: [aerospace] High Employee Concentration in Operations Department
description: The Operations department has the highest number of employees (14), which may indicate a potential over-reliance on this department for airport operations. This could lead to operational bottlenecks if key personnel are unavailable.
recommendations: Develop a succession plan for key roles
business_impact: Mitigating risks associated with personnel shortages can enhance operational resilience.

title: [aerospace] High Maintenance Costs for Specific Aircraft Types
description: The average parts cost for maintenance is $6965.00, with some maintenance tasks reaching up to $125,000. This suggests potential inefficiencies or issues with specific aircraft types that require costly repairs.
recommendations: Evaluate maintenance practices for high-cost aircraft
Consider fleet upgrades or replacements for older aircraft
business_impact: Identifying and addressing high maintenance costs can lead to significant cost savings.

title: [aerospace] Concentration of Delays Among Specific Carriers
description: The carrier KAL has the highest number of delays (17), indicating a potential operational issue specific to this airline. This could affect their reputation and customer loyalty.
recommendations: Collaborate with KAL to identify and resolve delay causes
Monitor performance metrics closely for KAL
business_impact: Addressing carrier-specific issues can enhance overall operational performance and customer satisfaction.
